machine_learning.definition: Machine Learning (ML) is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables computers to learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed. It focuses on developing algorithms that can access data and use it to learn patterns and make predictions or decisions.

types.name: Supervised Learning
types.description: Learning with labeled training data. The algorithm learns from input-output pairs to make predictions on new data.

types.name: Unsupervised Learning
types.description: Finding hidden patterns in data without labeled examples. The algorithm discovers structure in the data.

types.name: Reinforcement Learning
types.description: Learning through interaction with an environment using rewards and penalties to maximize cumulative reward.

artificial_intelligence.definition: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think and learn like humans. It encompasses machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and more.

branches.name: Deep Learning
branches.description: Neural networks with multiple layers that can learn complex patterns

branches.name: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
branches.description: Enabling computers to understand, interpret, and generate human language

branches.name: Large Language Models (LLM)
branches.description: Advanced AI models trained on vast amounts of text data to understand and generate human-like language, powering chatbots, content generation, and intelligent assistants

branches.name: Computer Vision
branches.description: Enabling computers to interpret and understand visual information from images and videos

branches.name: Robotics
branches.description: Creating intelligent machines that can perform physical tasks

branches.name: Expert Systems
branches.description: Computer systems that emulate decision-making abilities of human experts

ai_types.name: Narrow AI (Weak AI)
ai_types.description: AI designed for specific tasks (e.g., voice assistants, image recognition)

ai_types.name: General AI (Strong AI)
ai_types.description: AI with human-level cognitive abilities across all domains

ai_types.name: Superintelligence
ai_types.description: AI that surpasses human intelligence in all areas

llm_algorithms.definition: Large Language Models (LLMs) are advanced AI algorithms trained on massive datasets to understand, generate, and manipulate human language. They use transformer architectures and deep learning to achieve human-like text generation and comprehension.

architecture_types.name: Transformer Architecture
architecture_types.description: The foundational architecture for modern LLMs, using self-attention mechanisms to process sequences of text

architecture_types.name: Encoder-Decoder Models
architecture_types.description: Models with separate encoder and decoder components, ideal for tasks like translation and summarization

architecture_types.name: Decoder-Only Models
architecture_types.description: Autoregressive models that generate text sequentially, one token at a time

architecture_types.name: Encoder-Only Models
architecture_types.description: Bidirectional models that understand context from both directions, excellent for classification tasks

training_methods.name: Pre-training
training_methods.description: Initial training on large unlabeled text corpora to learn language patterns and world knowledge

training_methods.name: Fine-tuning
training_methods.description: Adapting pre-trained models to specific tasks or domains using labeled data

training_methods.name: Instruction Tuning
training_methods.description: Training models to follow instructions and respond in a helpful, harmless, and honest manner

training_methods.name: In-Context Learning
training_methods.description: Teaching models new tasks through examples provided in the prompt without updating weights

popular_models.name: Claude

optimization_techniques.name: Quantization
optimization_techniques.description: Reducing model precision to decrease memory and computation requirements

optimization_techniques.name: Pruning
optimization_techniques.description: Removing less important weights or neurons to reduce model size

optimization_techniques.name: Distillation
optimization_techniques.description: Training smaller models to mimic larger models' behavior

optimization_techniques.name: Efficient Architectures
optimization_techniques.description: Designing models with fewer parameters while maintaining performance

faq.question: Do you provide custom software development?
faq.answer: Yes, we specialize in custom software development including web applications, mobile apps, and desktop applications using modern technologies.

faq.answer: We provide LLM algorithms, machine learning models, natural language processing, computer vision, and AI-powered applications customized for your business requirements.

faq.question: What is machine learning?
faq.answer: Machine Learning is a subset of artificial intelligence that enables computers to learn and improve from experience without being explicitly programmed. It includes supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning approaches.

faq.question: What is artificial intelligence?
faq.answer: Artificial Intelligence is the simulation of human intelligence in machines, encompassing machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and robotics.

faq.question: Do you develop mobile applications?
